string.text: Prototype developed by scientists to protect people from psi-emissions. Needs adjusting.
Uncalibrated psi-helmet
Prototype developed by scientists to protect people from psi-emissions.
Psi-helmet
Doctor's key to a secret stash in Pripyat
Doctor's key
A key with "Hotel Polissya - Room 26" engraved on side.
Doctor's notes

"Just some notes about old men's conspiracy theories". \nThere are rumours that the Agroprom Institute was used as a front for an unofficial lab in the years preceding the 2006 year accident. This lab hosted a number of very unusual experiments. The traders have dug up a lot of information about these laboratories. I met with the Barkeep, he says he sent Duty scouts to get into the underground vaults of Dark Valley, called X-18, but they disappeared. There are another rumours regarding a "Psi-Brain" mechanism. The whole neighbourhood in Yantar is under the influence of that piece of trash - it zombified everyone who came within range. There is another mechanism in Red Forest radar underground, called Lab X-19, and that's what is likely to be the Brain Scorcher. There is evidence to suggest that the presence of the Brain Scorcher intentionally blocks the road to the North, but no one knows exactly what it is. The Barkeep believes that the Brain Scorcher is man-made, and these mechanisms are not always operating at full strength. He thinks there are periods when their power is lowered to cool down the apparatus. It's time to visit all the underground laboratories in the Zone and find out what kind of secrets they are hiding. Too bad, that I'm too old for this shit. I wish Strelok would be still around, but damn, he disappeared years ago.

A powerful electronic lock-pick. Strangely enough, it does not seem to be an all-purpose thieves' instrument. Rather, it seems to have been created with a specific electronic lock in mind and can't be used to override anything else.
Decoder
Stalker Diary
Stalker Diary

The personal notes and reflections of an unknown stalker. Most of the pages are ripped out. The final entry reads: "Returned from the north. Mission failed. Lucky to be alive. Alive... My god, we're still alive. The source of the blowouts is not where we thought it was. But if not there, then where? Found what seems to be an electronic key to a sophisticated door lock, if I could find what it goes to perhaps I will have found the true source. I can't stop thinking all the answers lie in the Sarcophagus, but it has proven to be impossible to get in to. Too much radiation, too many Monolith... I have to go back. Alone this time. I must try one last time. It's our only hope."
Classified Project Summaries

A fireproof briefcase containing classified reports on various tests and experiments. The reports seem to be the summaries of covert experimental research projects that were apparently being conducted throughout the Zone. The subject matters range from genetic and biological research to weapons development and wave field generation, as well as psychological studies including research into ESP, telekinesis, thought projection, and mind control.
Lab X-18 Documents

A collection of notes containing various data on experiments conducted in Lab X-18. The notes allude to the nature of the tests that were being performed there; subjecting living organisms to biological experimentation, genetic alteration, and exposing them to the effects of some sort of psychic field. The details of the experiments are not clear from the notes, but the effects listed are horrific; severe physical deformation, hyper-accelerated genetic mutation, liquefaction of the brain tissue, acute necrosis of the flesh, and death. The last few pages seem to hint at a device that was being researched to counter the fields, along with some figures and diagrams.
Emitter Prototype Documents

A report detailing the design and construction of the emitter hidden inside Lab X-16. The machine is a massive bio-mechanical field generator, powered by a conglomeration of cultivated brain cells weighing in at just over a metric ton. Early sections of the report describe the processes involved in designing and growing the brain matter, including harvesting the parent material from living donors. What possible use such a monstrous device could possibly serve is indeterminable from the content of the reports.
Rainbow Emitter Project Status

A report on the status of the experiments being conducted in Lab X-19. From the report, it appears the emitter constructed in Radar was the successor to the prototype built in Yantar. This newer emitter was far more powerful and did not rely on biological components to generate the psi-field. The initial tests are reported as being a massive success, however the report goes on to lament that a fundamental design flaw was causing the signal to degrade with time, prompting to the decision to cancel and decommission the project before it was fully completed. Mysteriously, the end of the report confirms that the emitter was indeed deactivated by the researchers before they abandoned the experiment. Who reactivated the emitter and why is unknown.
Prototype Weapon Specifications

Documents blueprinting the design and operation of an advanced electromagnetic device. From what can be gleaned from the notes, it seems to be the main component of an extremely powerful and highly accurate experimental rifle.

A report authorizing construction to continue of a third emitter within the Zone. While there are no technical details provided in the report, the text describes a far larger and massively more powerful device being built off the knowledge gained from the test facilities at Yantar and Radar. The report does not specify the exact location of this new emitter.
Emitter Project Documents
Order of Transfer

A tattered journal that seems to have once belonged to one of the former researchers that worked in the underground labs in the Zone. The journal itself does not contain much in the way of useful information, however there is an intriguing scrap of paper tucked inside the back cover; an order of transfer of equipment and personnel to a new laboratory being constructed to the north of the reactor. A hand-written note on the order reads, "Boris, meet us at the new project location as soon as you return, coordinates attached." Interestingly, there is a date written on the note; "26-04-1986", the day of the original Chernobyl disaster, however the note appears to have been written much later than that.
